p: Table 11 and Figure 19 present the crystal structures of the barium-aluminum hydrides. The crystal structure of BaAlH 5 is composed of corner-sharing (AlH 6) octahedra that form zigzag chains along the crystallographic c axis [ 207]. Meanwhile, Ba 2AlD 7 is composed of isolated (AlD 6) octahedra and infinite one-dimensional chains of edge-sharing (DBa 4) tetrahedra [ 235].
